intro: Osbeckia nutans, commonly known as the nodding willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Osbeckia nutans is often found in moist, disturbed soils such as along stream banks and in wet meadows. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
